mention.text: the Supreme Court Currently on the Federal Court of Appeals in Washington , D.C. , Judge Bork
the only position in government required by statute to be filled by someone '' learned in the law
dean of the University of Chicago Law School

neutral-principled '' judge -- a judge who makes decisions based on established legal principles irrespective of the '' bottom line '' of who may win and who may lose As Columbia University law Prof. Herbert Wechsler explained almost 30 years ago , a neutral-principled judicial decision rests '' on reasons that in their generality and their neutrality transcend any immediate result that is involved
judges , '' he explained in the same interview , '' is not confined to liberalism Conservatives
even well-intentioned judges Daniel Webster once warned
men in all ages who mean to govern well
men in all ages who mean to govern well mean to govern men in all ages who mean to govern well
men in all ages who mean to govern
men in all ages who mean to govern well
